content.prompt: Projective tests, such as the Rorschach inkblot test, have been justifiably criticized as tools for assessing personality because

choices.label: they elicit only obvious information from the examinee
they have not been found to be reliable and valid
the stimuli for the tests are not standardized
they provide a label for oneâ€™s psychological well-being

topic.text: 4.4: Psychodynamic and Humanistic Theories of Personality

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
